page.title: 12Ecology - Wild Service Tree.
page.content: Few native British trees can be noted as rare,but the Wild Service is really uncommon. There are only two known Service trees in Dyfed one near Llan- dovery and one is in Stradey Woods. At this latter location it grows on the site of an old Iron Age fort. It is an inconspicuous tree usually hidden in woods or confused with other tall hedgerow growths. Although not related,because of its leaf shape,the tree is sometimes mistaken for a Maple. (It is a member of the Whitebeam family.) The leaves' width usually being about the same as the length.The upper surface of the leaves are smooth,shiny and dark green in colour. Below they are paler.This tree grows slowly and reaches a great age. { It is our duty to see that this rare {tree is protected and does not die out {through our neglect and ignorance.}
